comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Emilio_Rabasa_Estebanell José Emilio Rabasa Estebanell (22 May 1856 — 25 April 1930) was a prominent 19th century Mexican writer, diplomat and liberal politician. He wrote extensively on Constitutional Law, served as Governor of Chiapas, as state congressman, chaired several Mexican Academies and co-founded El Universal; an influential newspaper in Mexico City.[1]

comment._content: Swanq and Richard Arthur Norton:  Thanks for linking this image to the Niagara Falls peace conference in 1914.  We will add some of the infomation to the description when we update.
